ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I have learned about the history of the discipline and different styles of doing ethnography. The group project is excellent. I have improved my writing and editing skills throughout the course.
My comprehensive reading as well as writing skills improved. I gained a solid understanding of the most widely known anthropologists' work.

My knowledge of classic ethnographies increased significantly. I got to know that diversity of ethnography has always been deeply rooted in anthropology. I can make critical assessment to the classic ethnographies as well as the critiques against them.
Overview of field, ability to critique and analyze ethnographic monographs, ability to write concisely, ability to work together with other students on collaborative writing project.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Great course. I really like the group project, even though, honestly, the workload is quite demanding.

The collaboration project is one of the great strengths of this course. I wish we would have done more in-class presentations and perhaps also focused more on the sociopolitical events that influenced the respective anthropologist's work.

Strengths: not only classic ethnographies themselves but very rich sources are provided for reference and background information; careful and timely comments for each week's writings; comprehensive training including presentation skills and citation formatting

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. It offers rare opportunities to scrutinize old ethnographies and discuss about them with fellow students and more senior anthropologists.
